relationships.evidence_text: Welcome to the Why on Earth Community Podcast. I'm your host, Aaron William Perry.
we're visiting with Jeff Hoppin, the author of Barefoot Bio Dynamics.
Jeff Poppin, a Midwestern farm boy, helped develop an organic farm and Tennessee homestead in the mid 1970s.
10 years later began applying bio-Dynamic methods and making the preparations to do so.
His livelihood comes primarily from vegetables and cattle grown on the 270 acre long hungry creek farm.
where cows, compost and community keep the land vibrant and productive.
Jeff advocates for a more peaceful agriculture by mentoring young farmers and gardeners along with a bit of lecturing, consulting, hosting events, and facilitating a few new farm enterprises.
Jeff advocates for a more peaceful agriculture by mentoring young farmers and gardeners.
His style of old time farming comes from paying close attention to what elder farmers thought felt and did.
